newsitem.title: MONACO: ATHLETICS-ELITE ATHLETES TO CARRY IDENTITY CARDS.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-ELITE ATHLETES TO CARRY IDENTITY CARDS.

text.p: Elite track and field athletes will be issued with identity cards from next season verifying that they have undergone out-of-competition tests.
International Amateur Athletic Federation (IAAF) president Primo Nebiolo told a news conference on Friday the cards would be issued to the top 20 athletes in each discipline.
"Without this card and without acceptances of this programme of random, unannounced and out-of-competition testing, no athlete will be eligible for cash awards," he said.
The IAAF is introducing prize money to its major competitions for the first time next year.
Nebiolo said athletes in the top 20 of their event would face a minimum of three out-of-competition tests a year.
